article: "I will never forget you," the old man said in tears. "I'm getting old. I can't take care of you anymore. Soon, I'll move to an old-age home and you can't come along. They don't _ dogs there. We'll find a nice new _ for you. With your good looks, we'll have no _ at all. Anyone would be _ to own such a fine dog." With great difficulty, the old man tied a _ to Monsieur DuPree's neck. It says, "Merry Christmas! My name is Monsieur DuPree. For breakfast, I like bacon and eggs. For dinner, I prefer potatoes and some meat. I eat just two meals a day. In return , I will be your most loyal friend." Then the old man reached for the dog's leash , opened the door and stepped outside, pulling the dog behind. Monsieur DuPree pulled _ . He didn't want to go. "Don't make this any _ for me. I promise you, you'll be much better off with someone else." After a very long time in the snow, they came across an old house. The old man _ and looked at the house _ . Lights decorated every window, _ the sound of a Christmas song was carried on the wind. "This will be a nice home for you," the old man unleashed his dog. " Go on now. Go up the steps and scratch at the door." Monsieur DuPree thought his master didn't love him anymore. Slowly he moved toward the _ . He scratched at the front door. "Woof!" A little boy _ . When he saw Monsieur DuPree, he shouted in _ , "Mom and Dad, come and see what Santa brought!" Through teary eyes, the old man _ from behind a tree. He saw the mother _ the note, and gently pull the dog inside. Smiling, the old man wiped his eyes, saying, "Merry Christmas, my friend."
